description: Master ACCA BT fundamentals including Business Organization, Stakeholders, IT Systems, and Professional Ethics

slides.title: Welcome to ACCA BT
slides.content:
# Business and Technology (BT)

BT introduces the **business environment** and **information technology** essentials for accountants.

## What You Will Learn

- **Business Organization** - Types and structures
- **Stakeholders** - Internal and external
- **IT Systems** - Technology in business
- **Professional Ethics** - ACCA Code of Ethics

## Syllabus Overview

| Area | Weight |
|------|--------|
| Business organization | 15% |
| Accounting and reporting | 10% |
| Leading and managing | 25% |
| Personal effectiveness | 15% |
| Professional ethics | 15% |
| IT and systems | 20% |

slides.title: Business Organizations
slides.content:
# Types of Business Organizations

## Legal Structures

| Type | Liability | Ownership |
|------|-----------|----------|
| Sole Trader | Unlimited | One person |
| Partnership | Unlimited | 2+ partners |
| Limited Company | Limited | Shareholders |
| LLP | Limited | Partners |

## Public vs Private

| Feature | Private | Public |
|---------|---------|--------|
| Shares | Restricted | Tradeable |
| Regulation | Less | More |
| Capital | Limited | Extensive |

## Not-for-Profit

- Charities

slides.title: Stakeholders
slides.content:
# Stakeholder Analysis

## Internal Stakeholders

| Group | Interest |
|-------|----------|
| Employees | Job security, pay |
| Managers | Performance, career |
| Directors | Strategy, returns |

## External Stakeholders

| Group | Interest |
|-------|----------|
| Shareholders | Dividends, growth |
| Creditors | Repayment |
| Customers | Quality, price |
| Suppliers | Payment, contracts |
| Government | Taxes, compliance |

## Mendelow's Matrix

```
           Power
       Low    High
High | Keep   | Key
Int  | Informed| Players
-----+--------+------
Low  | Minimal| Keep
Int  | Effort | Satisfied
```

slides.title: Corporate Governance
slides.content:
# Corporate Governance

## What is Governance?

The system by which companies are **directed and controlled**.

## Key Principles

| Principle | Description |
|-----------|-------------|
| Accountability | Answerable for actions |
| Transparency | Open information |
| Fairness | Equal treatment |
| Responsibility | Duty to stakeholders |

## Board Structure

- Executive Directors (EDs)
- Non-Executive Directors (NEDs)
- Chairman (often NED)
- CEO (Executive)

## Board Committees

| Committee | Role |
|-----------|------|
| Audit | Financial oversight |
| Remuneration | Director pay |
| Nomination | Board appointments |
| Risk | Risk management |

slides.title: Professional Ethics
slides.content:
# ACCA Code of Ethics

## Fundamental Principles

| Principle | Meaning |
|-----------|--------|
| Integrity | Honest and straightforward |
| Objectivity | Unbiased judgment |
| Professional Competence | Maintain skills |
| Confidentiality | Protect information |
| Professional Behavior | Comply with laws |

## Threats to Ethics

| Threat | Example |
|--------|--------|
| Self-interest | Financial interest |
| Self-review | Checking own work |
| Advocacy | Promoting client |
| Familiarity | Close relationship |
| Intimidation | Pressure to act |

## Safeguards

- Policies and procedures
- Independence requirements
- Quality control
- Disclosure

slides.title: Ethical Conflicts
slides.content:
# Resolving Ethical Issues

## Conflict Resolution Process

1. Identify the issue
2. Gather relevant facts
3. Consider affected parties
4. Identify courses of action
5. Evaluate consequences
6. Make decision
7. Document

## When to Seek Advice

- Complex situations
- Significant impact
- Uncertain about rules
- Conflicting requirements

## Reporting Misconduct

| To Whom | When |
|---------|------|
| Internal (manager) | First step |
| Senior management | If unresolved |
| ACCA | Serious matters |
| Regulators | Legal requirement |

## Whistleblowing

- Report wrongdoing
- Protected by law
- Last resort internally

## ERP Systems

- Single database
- Real-time data

slides.title: Audit and Assurance
slides.content:
# Audit Basics

## Types of Audit

| Type | Purpose |
|------|--------|
| External | Independent opinion |
| Internal | Operational review |
| Statutory | Legal requirement |

## Audit Process

1. Planning
2. Risk assessment
3. Testing controls
4. Substantive testing
5. Reporting

## Audit Opinion

| Type | Meaning |
|------|--------|
| Unmodified | Clean opinion |
| Qualified | Except for... |
| Adverse | Materially misstated |
| Disclaimer | Unable to form |
